chat_text: One of the crew fell from the mast and their thigh is completely deformed with a bone sticking out. They are barely awake and breathing very fast. There is a lot of blood and they look incredibly pale.
He got hit hard in the chest by the boom and now he can't catch his breath. He’s struggling to breathe, his neck veins are bulging out, and his lips are turning blue.
main_problem: One side of chest not moving

chat_text: A heavy block hit her in the head and blood is literally pulsing out in a spray. She’s awake but there’s a massive amount of bright red blood everywhere.
Her hand got sucked into the electric winch. Three fingers are gone and the stumps are bleeding uncontrollably. She’s passed out and her skin is cold and white.
He was thrown against the cockpit table during a roll. His stomach is becoming very hard and bloated, he’s breathing fast, and he looks like he’s going into shock.
An anchor fell on his foot. The pain is a 9 out of 10, his foot is turning blue and cold, and I can't find a pulse anywhere on his ankle.
main_problem: Swollen, blue, no pulse in foot

chat_text: He slammed his chest into a winch. Part of his ribcage is moving inward when he breathes in and outward when he breathes out. He’s in a lot of pain and struggling for air.
She hit her head on the deck. She’s very confused, keep throwing up, and one of her pupils is much larger than the other.
cause: Slip on wet deck, head hit GRP

chat_text: He reached for the rail during a big wave and his shoulder popped out. It looks completely misshapen and he can't move his arm at all.
The spinnaker pole shattered and a long, sharp piece of carbon fiber is stuck deep in his thigh. It’s not bleeding much but the object is still in there.
main_problem: Shard of carbon fiber in thigh

chat_text: We pulled him out of the water after 30 minutes. He’s stopped shivering, he’s mumbles when he speaks, and his body feels ice cold and stiff.
He’s been working in the engine room and now he’s unconscious. His skin is red and bone dry, he’s having a seizure, and he feels like he's burning up.
She swallowed a lot of water when she fell overboard. She’s coughing constantly, gasping for air, and her lips look blue.
He’s been seasick for days and hasn't peed in 24 hours. His eyes are sunken in, he’s very weak, and he has a slight fever.
He fell asleep on deck and has a massive sunburn. Almost half his body is covered in large blisters and he’s shaking even though he has a fever.
cause: Fallen asleep on deck in doldrums

chat_text: His boots have been wet for four days straight. His feet are completely white, numb, and the skin is starting to peel off in chunks.
cause: 4 days in wet boots on watch

chat_text: He’s been drinking gallons of water but eating no salt. Now he’s staggering around like he’s drunk and his speech is totally slurred.
We’ve been handling ice-cold lines and his fingers have turned hard and gray-black. He can't feel them at all.
He came up too fast after checking the hull. He’s acting very strangely, giggling, and seems totally confused about where he is.
The boat was hit by lightning. He’s unconscious and not breathing. I can't find a pulse and there are weird burn marks on his skin.
cause: Direct hit on mast during storm

chat_text: She has a 9 out of 10 pain in her lower right stomach. If I press down and let go, the pain is even worse. She also has a fever.
An old coral cut on his leg has red streaks coming out of it. He’s shaking with chills, has a high fever, and his blood pressure seems very low.
He got bit by an insect and now his throat is swelling up. He’s wheezing, covered in hives, and looks like he’s about to pass out.
He says it feels like an elephant is sitting on his chest. The pain is going down his left arm, he’s sweating, and his pulse feels irregular.
He’s very confused and his breath smells sweet, almost like fruit. He’s breathing very deeply and fast and says he’s incredibly thirsty.
He has a sudden, agonizing pain in his stomach. His belly feels as hard as a board and he’s pale and sweating.
He’s in 10 out of 10 pain in his side and back. He’s pacing around because he can't get comfortable and there is blood in his urine.
She’s having a massive asthma attack. Her inhaler isn't working and I can't hear any air moving in her chest at all. Her lips are turning blue.
One side of his face is drooping and he can't move his right arm or leg. He’s awake but his blood pressure is extremely high.
He’s been having a violent seizure for over five minutes straight and it won't stop. His breathing is irregular and he’s turning red.
Everyone in the cabin is lethargic with a headache. One person has bright red skin and is breathing very slowly. We suspect an exhaust leak.
We ate a barracuda and now he’s acting weird. He says cold water feels hot to him, and his heart rate has dropped to 40 beats per minute.
main_problem: Hot feels cold, cold feels hot

chat_text: He was stung by a jellyfish and went into cardiac arrest almost immediately. There are massive red welts all over his chest and legs.
A small cut on her leg has turned into a massive, hot, red swelling that is spreading quickly. She has a high fever.
Battery acid splashed directly into his eyes. He can't open them, he’s in 10 out of 10 pain, and his eyes look hazy and white.
He’s been sick since he inhaled some vomit. He’s coughing up green gunk, has a high fever, and is struggling to breathe.
He’s in extreme pain because he hasn't been able to pee for hours. His lower stomach is hard and bulging.
His tooth is broken and now his entire face is swollen. His eye is starting to swell shut and he has a high fever.
He suddenly got a sharp pain in his chest and can't breathe. His lips are blue and he’s coughing up a little bit of blood.
He hasn't been able to go to the bathroom or pass gas. Now he is actually vomiting stuff that smells like a bowel movement.
He has a high fever and his gums are bleeding. He’s covered in dark, blackish bruises and looks very weak.
He’s totally confused and has a 40.5°C fever. His eyes look yellow and he’s breathing very fast.
He has constant, explosive diarrhea that smells like sulfur. He’s becoming very dehydrated and lightheaded.
His eye is bright red and filled with pus. He says it feels like there is sand in it and he can't look at any light.
cause: Contact lens left in too long

chat_text: He has sudden, 9 out of 10 pain in his groin. One side is swollen to the size of a grapefruit and he has a fever.
He has a very high fever and a splitting headache. His neck is so stiff he can't touch his chin to his chest and light hurts his eyes.
He has a huge, painful, pus-filled lump that looks like a spider bite. It’s hot to the touch and he has a fever.
His eyes are bright red, his skin looks yellow, and his calves are in a lot of pain. He has a high fever and low blood pressure.
He stepped on a sea urchin and has over 20 spines stuck in his foot. His joints are starting to feel stiff and lock up.
She has a sudden, ripping pain in her lower stomach and just fainted. She is very pale, cold, and her blood pressure is very low.
